attributes.action: Change To Proportional Representation Voting System.
attributes.additional_details:
The current first past the post voting system is not a fair system. Many people do not bother to vote because they feel that their vote does not count & if they do vote they do not really have any power to influence the make up of parliament. 
Gen Election July 2024 results.
Labour        9.7 m votes                  412 seats
Tories          6.8m votes                   121 seats
Lib Dems    3.5m votes                     72 seats
Reform        4.0m votes                      5  seats
attributes.background: First Past The Post is the electoral system currently used for elections to the Westminster Parliament. It does not accurately reflect votes cast and needs replacing with a system of proportional representation. Our current system leaves many feeling their voice is not heard in parliament.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/700109
